name: Muslim American Youth Foundation
mission: Our mission is to educate and instil a drive for personal academic success, enrich through experience and expansion of what is really possible, and enlighten by means of taking the aforementioned experiences and incorporating them into their personal lives, households and communities.
theoryOfChange: Educate, Enrich, and Enlighten: providing culturally relevant and spiritually grounded programs (inputs) to strengthen identity and values (outputs) to enable youth to lead and uplift communities (outcomes).
zakatClaimEvidence: The official website and descriptions of Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) programs do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth and their communities through educational, sports, faith, health advocacy, and social justice programs.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: UNKNOWN (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 33/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, domestic poverty cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document why reserves above your policy target are intentional (e.g., restrictions, volatility, planned commitments) and define deployment triggers.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Youth Foundation shows good alignment and good impact (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The official website and descriptions of Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) programs do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth and their communities through educational, sports, faith, health advocacy, and social justice programs.

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a 72.1% program expense ratio and a fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised.
The foundation recorded total revenue of $1,734,105 and holds 13.4 months of working capital.
The mission of the foundation is to create and operate a facility for youth education, enrichment, and enlightenment.
Donors can contribute to the foundation's programs through various sadaqah-eligible donation options.
The organization provides opportunities for community engagement and volunteering within its youth programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate overall score due to its efficient fundraising and solid working capital, though its total score is constrained by limited public data and a lack of independent impact verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external data availability resulting in low data confidence scores
Lack of third-party impact evaluations or cost-per-beneficiary metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: The foundation shows a medium alignment for donors interested in domestic poverty and youth development, offering clear pathways for engagement through volunteering and sadaqah [4][5]. While it serves a specific community niche, the overall data confidence remains low due to limited reporting [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to capacity building by maintaining a 72.1% program expense ratio to fund its youth facility and mentoring programs [1][2]. However, the absence of specific cost-per-beneficiary data and third-party verification results in a moderate impact score [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim American Youth Foundation provides a dedicated facility for the education, enrichment, and athletic development of youth within the community.
strengths: Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.03 per $1 raised
Healthy liquidity with 13.4 months of working capital available
Diverse programming ranging from athletics to academic mentoring
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) operates as a community-focused organization dedicated to creating a facility for youth education and enlightenment [2][3]. With a total revenue of $1,734,105, the foundation manages diverse programs including community services, youth sports, and mentoring initiatives [1][2]. Supporters can contribute to these efforts through various sadaqah-eligible giving methods to support the organization's domestic mission [4].
